message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.ST, cs.IT. 

The paper presents a framework for learning with probability distributions using Wasserstein distance, which is a popular distance measure in machine learning and statistics. The paper focuses on the theoretical analysis of the proposed framework and provides experimental results to support the claims. Based on this, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) as these sub-categories are closely related to the topic of the paper. Additionally, the paper also discusses the computational tractability of the proposed approach, which suggests that it may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.ST (Statistics) and cs.IT (Information Theory).
